content.statement: aku-008-twin-primes-conjectures is a fundamental concept in Science Math Number-Theory Primes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aku-008-twin-primes-conjectures helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aku-008-twin-primes-conjectures include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aku-008-twin-primes-conjectures.

definitions_glossary.prime_gap: Difference between consecutive primes: g_n = p_{n+1} - p_n
definitions_glossary.bruns_constant: Sum of reciprocals of all twin primes ≈ 1.902
definitions_glossary.bounded_gaps: Prime pairs with differences bounded by some constant

related_conjectures.name: Twin Prime Conjecture
related_conjectures.statement: Infinitely many primes p where p+2 is also prime

related_conjectures.name: Cousin Prime Conjecture
related_conjectures.statement: Infinitely many primes p where p+4 is also prime

related_conjectures.name: Sexy Prime Conjecture
related_conjectures.statement: Infinitely many primes p where p+6 is also prime

related_conjectures.name: Polignac's Conjecture
related_conjectures.statement: For every even k, infinitely many prime pairs with gap k

related_conjectures.name: Hardy-Littlewood k-tuple Conjecture
related_conjectures.statement: General conjecture predicting density of prime constellations

recent_progress.result: Brun proves sum of twin prime reciprocals converges
Infinitely many prime pairs with gap < 70,000,000
Gap bound reduced to 6 (conditional on Elliott-Halberstam)

heuristics.hardy_littlewood_prediction: Number of twin primes ≤ x is approximately 2C₂(x/ln²(x)) where C₂ ≈ 0.66016 (twin prime constant)
heuristics.probabilistic_argument: Probability that n is prime ≈ 1/ln(n). If independent, probability both n and n+2 are prime ≈ 1/ln²(n). Summing suggests infinitely many, but independence is not rigorous.

definition.@value: Prime pairs differing by 2; conjecture states infinitely many exist

prerequisites.title: Prime Numbers
prerequisites.reason: Twin primes are special prime pairs

enables.title: Analytic Number Theory Methods
enables.reason: Twin prime research drives development of new techniques

enables.title: Distributed Computing Projects
enables.reason: Searching for large twin primes uses distributed computing

related.relationship: Another famous unsolved conjecture about primes

skos:related.skos:note: Another major unsolved problem about primes

learning_objectives: Define twin primes and recognize examples
Appreciate why the conjecture is difficult to prove
Recognize connections to other prime conjectures
common_errors: Thinking the conjecture is proven (still open)
Confusing bounded gaps result with full conjecture
Not understanding why proof is so difficult
Assuming twin primes stop appearing at some point
teaching_tips: Start by listing first 20 primes and identifying twin pairs
Show how twin primes become 'rarer' but continue appearing
Discuss Zhang's breakthrough in accessible terms
Use visualization: plot prime gaps to show gap-2 occurrences
Connect to human curiosity: 2000+ year old unsolved problem
